query.formula: A[] ROMStage.ReadyToRunROMExt imply (PmpRegions[0].execute && PmpRegions[0].startAddress <= ROMStage.currentManifest.entryPoint && PmpRegions[0].endAddress >= ROMStage.currentManifest.entryPoint)
query.comment: Whenever the rom ext is running, it must be true, that the PMP regions allow for executing that entrypoint.
The ROM Stage will never fail. This is due to the hardcoded values in the manifest / memory. If we eventually implement non-determinism, we expect that this property might not hold.
If the signature cannot be decrypted and be equal to the image code, the state will eventually be back to startOfLoop
We will always reach a state where the rom ext is running.
